name: Georg Nees' Schotter
description: This piece is inspired by Georg Nees’ Schotter, where an orderly grid of squares gradually breaks into chaos as they move down the canvas.

name: Georg Nees' Schotter Variation
description: This piece is a variation of Georg Nees’ Schotter, but with a little twist. You can control the number of rows and columns with sliders to explore different levels of order and chaos.

name: Chromatic Grid
description: This sketch creates a grid of rotating squares that blend smoothly from one random color at the top to another at the bottom. You can click the canvas to save your own random piece of artwork.

name: The Thundercloud
description: This generative piece uses Perlin noise to create a grid of circles with varying sizes and shades, forming a textured, cloud-like pattern that resembles a thundercloud.

name: Flow Field
description: This artwork uses a flow field to guide hundreds of tiny lines across the canvas, drawing thin lines that trace their paths. The result is a dynamic, flowing pattern with a smooth vertical gradient between two random colors, creating an abstract, river-like movement over canvas. Click on canvas to save your one and only piece of art.

name: Fireworks
description: Colorful fireworks shoot up and explode into sparkling particles, creating a dynamic, fading light show across the canvas

name: Gravity Sound
description: Circles swing and collide, with each collision there is a 30% chance of playing a tone for an audio-visual effect.
